Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>

Entry.JapaneseText: ミルハウスト
Entry.EnglishText: Milhaust

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Agarte>
Entry.EnglishText: <Agarte>

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の子
Entry.EnglishText: Girl

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア兵
Entry.EnglishText: Callegean Soldier

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 町の人たちが祈りを捧げている。
Entry.EnglishText: The townsfolk are all praying.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうも、この街の連中は ガジュマとヒューマが一緒なのが、 気に入らないみたいね。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems as though they don't like having Huma and Gajuma associate with each other here.

Entry.JapaneseText: ちぇッ、ラジルダと同じってか。 ムナクソ悪い街だぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: Tch, just like Razilda, huh? This town makes me sick to my stomach!

Entry.JapaneseText: となると…… まともに話を聞けそうなのは、 スージーぐらいか……
Entry.EnglishText: If that's the case, then... Susie is probably the only person here who we can talk to.

Entry.JapaneseText: どこへ行くんだ、クレア。
Entry.EnglishText: Claire, where are you going?

Entry.JapaneseText: あ、あなたこそ…… 休まなくていいの？
Entry.EnglishText: I-I could ask the same thing... Wouldn't you rather be resting?

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだか…… 落ち着かない気分なんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: I can't seem to settle down for some reason.

Entry.JapaneseText: わ、私もなの……
Entry.EnglishText: W-well, I can't either...

Entry.JapaneseText: そうか…… 散歩でもしないか？
Entry.EnglishText: I see. Why don't we go for a walk, then?

Entry.JapaneseText: え……で、でも……
Entry.EnglishText: Uh... B-but...

Entry.JapaneseText: ひとりで歩くのは物騒だ。 それに……
Entry.EnglishText: It's not safe going for a walk by yourself. Besides...

Entry.JapaneseText: 「急がないと、キミは 大切なものを失う事になる！」
Entry.EnglishText: "...If you don't hurry, you're going to lose something precious to you!"

Entry.JapaneseText: 行こう。
Entry.EnglishText: Just come with me.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……本当に、本当に アガーテ様なのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Are... Are you really Queen Agarte?

Entry.JapaneseText: 人の心が入れ替わるなどという事が、 ありうるのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: How is it possible for someone to switch bodies with another?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……<Yellow>月のフォルス<White>…… 王家に伝わるそのフォルスを 使えば、可能なのです……
Entry.EnglishText: ...It's possible with the <Yellow>Force of Moon<White>... The Force that has been passed down through the Royal Family is what made this possible.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Yellow>月のフォルス<White>…… それがあれば……他人の身体を 手に入れられるというの？
Entry.EnglishText: The <Yellow>Force of Moon<White>... So that power allows you to take someone else's body?

Entry.JapaneseText: なぜ、そのような事を……
Entry.EnglishText: Why would you do such a thing?

Entry.JapaneseText: なぜ、今まで黙って おられたのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Why have you kept quiet about this for so long?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ごめんなさい…… だますつもりはありませんでした…… でも……言えなかったのです……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm truly sorry. I had no intention of deceiving you, but I couldn't bring myself to speak up.

Entry.JapaneseText: 陛下、おやめください…… 私が悪いのです……
Entry.EnglishText: Your Majesty, please do not blame yourself. I am the one at fault.

Entry.JapaneseText: 陛下がカレギア城に 戻っていらっしゃった時、 私が気づいてさしあげれば……
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps if I had been able to recognize that it was you when you had returned to Callegea Castle, then...

Entry.JapaneseText: ミルハウスト……
Entry.EnglishText: Milhaust...

Entry.JapaneseText: そういう問題かよ!! それでクレアさんが…… えっと、ホンモノのクレアさんが、 どんな目にあったか……
Entry.EnglishText: I think you're missing the real issue here! What about Claire... er, the real Claire... Do you have any idea what she must have been going through?!

Entry.JapaneseText: 陛下は、ご自分の身体が 生きているという事を ご存知だったのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Your Majesty, did you have any idea of whether or not your actual body had survived?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ラジルダで気づいて…… キョグエンで捕まった時には、 隣の部屋に……
Entry.EnglishText: I was made aware of it in Razilda... And when I was captured in Kyogen, she was in the room next to mine...

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだって!!
Entry.EnglishText: What?!

Entry.JapaneseText: じゃ、じゃあ、あんたはクレアさんが 連れて行かれたのを知ってて、 黙ってたって言うのかよ!!
Entry.EnglishText: You knew that they made off with Claire and you didn't say a damn thing about it?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ごめんなさい…… ごめんなさい…… ごめんなさい……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sorry. I'm sorry... I'm sorry!

Entry.JapaneseText: 皆さん、それ以上、 女王様を責めないでください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please don't get carried away with admonishing the Queen, everyone.
Entry.Notes: Maybe something like: "Everyone, please don't be so harsh to the queen!"

Entry.JapaneseText: だけど……
Entry.EnglishText: But she...

Entry.JapaneseText: 見た目が変わったら、 周囲の反応も変わるものです。 本当の事を言いたくても 言えない事だってあります。
Entry.EnglishText: When your appearance changes, the way people respond to you changes as well. Even if you want to speak the truth, it's not always so simple.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私には、アガーテ様の つらい気持ちがわかります。
Entry.EnglishText: I understand how hard it must have been for her.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……とにかく、今すぐクレアに 身体を返してやってほしい。 今のオレの願いは、それだけだ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Well, I just want for you to give Claire her body back now. That's all I ask.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は……わたくしは……
ごめんなさい…… 本当にごめんなさい……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm so sorry... I'm truly sorry!

Entry.JapaneseText: 陛下!!
Entry.EnglishText: Your Majesty!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだ、なんだ？ 一体、どうしたっていうんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Wait, what? Where does she think she's going?

Entry.JapaneseText: とにかく、 オレたちも追うんだ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Come on, we need to follow her!

Entry.JapaneseText: 人の心が入れ替わるなどという事が、 ありうるのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: How is it possible for someone to switch bodies with another?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……<Yellow>月のフォルス<White>…… 王家に伝わるそのフォルスを 使えば、可能なのです……
Entry.EnglishText: ...It's possible with the <Yellow>Force of Moon<White>... The Force that has been passed down through the Royal Family is what made this possible.

Entry.JapaneseText: なぜ、そのような事を……
Entry.EnglishText: Why would you do such a thing?

Entry.JapaneseText: そうだ、なぜそんな事をしたんだ!? なぜクレアがこんな事に……
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, why would you do that?! Why would you put Claire through that?!

Entry.JapaneseText: クルルルゥ……
Entry.EnglishText: Coo... Coo...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……えっと、ガジュマさんと お話しちゃいけないって、 お母さんが言ってたの……
Entry.EnglishText: Uhmm... My mom told me not to talk to Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ここはね、 ミール広場っていうの。
Entry.EnglishText: This place is called the Mir Square!

Entry.JapaneseText: 昔の言葉で、ミールは 平和っていう意味だって お母さんが言ってたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: My mom told me that it means "peace" in the old language.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……わぁ、お姫様みたいな ガジュマさん……！ でも、お話しちゃいけないの。 お母さんが言ってたから……
Entry.EnglishText: Wow! Miss Gajuma, you look like a pretty princess! Oh... But my mom told me I musn't talk to Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマさんとは お話しちゃいけないの。 でも、どうしてかな……？
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not allowed to speak to Gajuma. I wonder why...?

Entry.JapaneseText: この広場にはね、前はね、 ヒューマさんとガジュマさんの 仲良くしてる銅像があったの。
Entry.EnglishText: You know, there used to be a bronze statue here with a Huma and Gajuma together!

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、スカラベ様が、 壊しちゃったの……
Entry.EnglishText: But Lord Scarabe had it destroyed...

Entry.JapaneseText: この広場にはね、前はね、 ヒューマさんとガジュマさんの 仲良くしてる銅像があったの。
Entry.EnglishText: You know, there used to be a bronze statue here with a Huma and Gajuma together!

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、スカラベ様が、 壊しちゃったの……
Entry.EnglishText: But Lord Scarabe had it destroyed...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマさんとは お話しちゃいけないの。 でも、どうしてかな……？
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not allowed to speak to Gajuma. I wonder why...?

Entry.JapaneseText: さっき、ガジュマさんたちが スカラベ様のお家のほうへ 行ったよ。
Entry.EnglishText: A lot of Gajuma headed towards Lord Scarabe's house over there.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ヒューマとガジュマは お話しちゃいけないの。 でも、おじさんはヒューマと 仲良くしてる……変なの……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma and Gajuma shouldn't talk to each other. But... you're getting along with Huma. You're weird!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマはガジュマと お話しちゃいけないのに、 明日、スカラベ様はガジュマさんと お話するんだって……変なの……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma musn't talk to Gajuma, but Lord Scarabe is going to talk to them tomorrow... Weird...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ヒューマとガジュマは お話しちゃいけないの。 でも、おじさんはヒューマと 仲良くしてる……変なの……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma and Gajuma shouldn't talk to each other. But... you're getting along with Huma. You're weird!

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、どうしてスカラベ様は 女王様を捕まえたの？ ガジュマだからなの？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, why did Lord Scarabe capture Her Majesty? Is it because she's a Gajuma?

Entry.JapaneseText: えっとね、ミルハウストさんって いう、偉い将軍様がね、 ヒューマとガジュマは仲良く しなきゃいけないって言ってたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You know, there's this really important person called Milhaust. He said that Huma and Gajuma must get along with each other.

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、私もガジュマさんと なかよくするの。
Entry.EnglishText: That's why I'll try to get along with Gajuma too!

Entry.JapaneseText: えっとね、私、みんな なかよくしたほうが 楽しいと思うの。
Entry.EnglishText: Uhm... I think it's more fun if everyone got along with each other!

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、私もガジュマさんと なかよくするの。
Entry.EnglishText: That's why I'll try to get along with Gajuma too!

Entry.JapaneseText: 何の音かなぁ？ カミナリが来るのかなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what this sound is? Is there going to be a thunderstorm?

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当、わかんない事 ばっかり……
Entry.EnglishText: I really don't know a lot...
Entry.Notes: deepL says: I really don't get it. All I know is ...... marking as problematic just in case.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてヒューマは、 ガジュマと仲良くしちゃ いけないのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: Why are Huma not allowed to get along with Gajuma?

Entry.JapaneseText: 地鳴りというのは、浅発地震や 火山活動などによって大地の振動が 空気に伝わって音が聞こえるものだ。
Entry.EnglishText: "Rumblings" are when sound from shallow earthquakes and volcanic activity gets transmitted through the air.

Entry.JapaneseText: どこかで、地震でも 起きているというのか……
Entry.EnglishText: Somewhere out there, there's an earthquake happening...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私がいる以上、ここでは 二度と事件は起こさせはしない。
Entry.EnglishText: As long as I'm here, no accident will ever happen again.

Entry.JapaneseText: 一般的に、右利きの人は 左回りのほうが動きやすいものだ。
Entry.EnglishText: In general, right-handed people find it easier to move counter-clockwise.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私はどちら利きか、 わかるかね？
Entry.EnglishText: Can you guess which is my dominant side?

Entry.JapaneseText: 住民たちが集まり始めてから、 この辺り一帯の空気が穏やかに なったような気がする。
Entry.EnglishText: Ever since that assembly happened, I can't help but feel like this area has gotten more peaceful.

Entry.JapaneseText: 地鳴りが聞こえる？ 地面も揺れている？ 歩いているとわからんな。
Entry.EnglishText: Can you hear that rumbling? Is the ground shaking? I can't really tell.

Entry.JapaneseText: クレアというヒューマの娘を 見かけなかったか？
Entry.EnglishText: Did you see this Huma girl called Claire?

Entry.JapaneseText: 伝説の海賊王アイフリードの 子孫がこの街にいるらしい。
Entry.EnglishText: Apparently one of the Pirate King Aifread's descendants are in this town.

Entry.JapaneseText: 海賊王なら莫大な資産を 残したはずだが、この街には それらしき人物は見当たらない……
Entry.EnglishText: A Pirate King would have left a vast amount of treasure, but I don't see anyone who fits the bill.

Entry.JapaneseText: この街から見渡す山々は 本当に美しい景色ばかりだ。
Entry.EnglishText: That mountain range you see in the distance really is pretty.

Entry.JapaneseText: この景色の中で暮らしているのに なぜ、こんなにも人々の心は すさんでしまっているんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Makes me wonder why the people around here are like this, even when they're around such peaceful scenery.

Entry.JapaneseText: 争っていたはずの 人々が共に……
Entry.EnglishText: People who should have been working together are...

Entry.JapaneseText: 何かあたたかく、心強い力が この広場にあふれているようだ。
Entry.EnglishText: For some reason, there's this really reassuring feeling spreading around the square.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何か聞こえるような 気もするが…… 調べようもない事だ。
Entry.EnglishText: I think I'm hearing things... I can't go and check it out, though.

Entry.JapaneseText: この先の屋敷の主人は カレギア軍によって 拘束されている。
Entry.EnglishText: The owner of that mansion over there is currently under the Army's supervision.

Entry.JapaneseText: この街に、海賊王の子孫が いると聞いたが…… どうにもうさんくさい話だ。
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that there's someone around here who's a pirate's descendant. Sounds mega shady, if you ask me.

Entry.JapaneseText: もし本当にいるのなら、 スカラベでなく、その男が 街を仕切っていそうだが……
Entry.EnglishText: Coz if it's true, then shouldn't it be him who's supposed to be leading the town and not Scarabe?

Entry.JapaneseText: 種族間の抗争を起こせば、 厳罰に処せられる。 言動には注意するように。
Entry.EnglishText: Cause an interspecies fight and you will be severely punished. Watch yourself.

Entry.JapaneseText: バイラスに注意するんだ。 どこに現れてもおかしくない。
Entry.EnglishText: Keep an eye out for Biruses. Those slimy monsters can appear out-of-nowhere.

Entry.JapaneseText: 遠鳴りはそれほど珍しくない。 山の上のほうで、天気が荒れてる だけだと思うが……
Entry.EnglishText: Distant roars are not really uncommon here because the mountain over there usually gets them, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: クレアというヒューマの娘を 見かけたら、軍まで知らせてほしい。
Entry.EnglishText: Please tell the army immediately if you see a female Huma named Claire.

Entry.JapaneseText: この街に住む、マウロという男が、 自分を海賊の子孫だと言っている そうだが……心配だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Some guy named Mauro did say that he was a descendant of some pirate, but... I wonder...

Entry.JapaneseText: せっかくスカラベを拘束して、 治安維持にあたっているのに、 何かよからぬ事を考えてなければ いいのだが……
Entry.EnglishText: I'd prefer it if you refrain from doing any mischief around here... Especially since we're working hard to maintain the peace now that Scarabe's gone.

Entry.JapaneseText: この街の治安はよくない。 出歩く時は注意するように。
Entry.EnglishText: The peace and order of this town is currently unstable. Please keep your guard up when walking around town.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText:
<speed:0>『調和の像』 ヒューマとガジュマの調和を 表現した像。
「我々は、この像のもとで 調和と平和を願う」
台座の上にあったであろう像は 破壊されており、姿がない。
Entry.EnglishText:
<speed:0>- Statue of Harmony - A painting representing harmony between Huma and Gajuma.
"Under this statue, we shall wish for peace and harmony"
It seems like the statue above this pedestal has already been destroyed. There is nothing on top of it.
